newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistan auctions 4.07 bln rupees of 6-month bonds.
newsitem.headline: Pakistan auctions 4.07 bln rupees of 6-month bonds.

text.p: The State (central) Bank of Pakistan auctioned 4.070 billion rupees ($113.5 million) of six-month short-term federal bonds on Tuesday, at a weighted average yield of 16.9403 percent a year, to be settled on Thursday.
The bank had set a pre-auction target of 5.0 billion rupees and received bids worth 5.370 billion rupees. Of those, 4.070 billion rupees of bids were accepted.
At the last auction on December 31, bids worth 1.092 billion rupees were accepted at a weighted average yield of 16.9500 percent a year.
